CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 27, 1939, pg. 18, reads: "Gaines Funeral Home Reflects 'The World of Tomorrow' Most Modern Equipment Plus Scientific, Efficient Service Marks New Step Forward ... Pictures reading top left to right: ... PRIVATE OFFICE - George W. Gaines has practised in Western Pennsylvania for the last 20 years. He graduated from Eckles College of Embalming in Philadelphia in 1914.  He is a native of Suffolk, Va., son of the late Rev. W. W. and Lula Gaines... THE FUNERAL services may be held in home, in the church or in Gaines' well appointed chapel.  Complete arrangements for the services will be made by one of the staff, including the minister of the family's choice, the music and musicians and even the pallbearers, if desired.- Photos by Harris ... George W. Gaines, Director of Funerals ... 220 Auburn Street, E. E., Pittsburgh, Pa." image published in advertisement in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 6, 1941, pg. 12, for "Negro Trade Week - September 8th - September 13th."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of George W. Gaines holding pen and seated desk, in office of Gaines Funeral Home
